title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {humind: Calculate Usual Humanitarian Composite Indicators},   author = {Guillaume Noblet},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.5.2,  https://gnoblet.github.io/humind/},   url = {https://github.com/gnoblet/humind}, }

title: Calculate Usual Humanitarian Composite Indicators
text: package gives helpers calculate usual humanitarian composite indicators food sec indicators (rCSI, LCSI, HHS, FCS), Washington Group Short Set questions, helpers calculating % HHs reported least one damage shelter.

title: Calculate Usual Humanitarian Composite Indicators
text: can install development version humind like :
code: devtools::install_github("gnoblet/humind")

title: Calculate Usual Humanitarian Composite Indicators
text: construction.

what: Add summarized individual WG-SS data to the household data — add_roster_wgq_ss
title: Add summarized individual WG-SS data to the household data — add_roster_wgq_ss
text: Add summarized individual WG-SS data household data

title: Add summarized individual WG-SS data to the household data — add_roster_wgq_ss
code: add_roster_wgq_ss(   roster,   hh,   id_col = "uuid",   wgq_disability = "wgq_disability",   wgq_disability_3 = "wgq_disability_3",   wgq_disability_4 = "wgq_disability_4",   wgq_vision_3 = "wgq_vision_3",   wgq_hearing_3 = "wgq_hearing_3",   wgq_mobility_3 = "wgq_mobility_3",   wgq_cognition_3 = "wgq_cognition_3",   wgq_self_care_3 = "wgq_self_care_3",   wgq_communication_3 = "wgq_communication_3",   wgq_vision_4 = "wgq_vision_4",   wgq_hearing_4 = "wgq_hearing_4",   wgq_mobility_4 = "wgq_mobility_4",   wgq_cognition_4 = "wgq_cognition_4",   wgq_self_care_4 = "wgq_mobility_4",   wgq_communication_4 = "wgq_communication_4" )

title: Add summarized individual WG-SS data to the household data — add_roster_wgq_ss
text: roster data frame individual-level data. hh data frame household-level data. id_col Survey unique identifier column (must present roster hh). wgq_disability Dummy roster. One group SS reported lot difficulty . wgq_disability_3 Dummy roster. One group SS reported lot difficulty. wgq_disability_4 Dummy roster. One group SS reported . wgq_vision_3 Dummy roster. Group vision reported lot difficulty. wgq_hearing_3 Dummy roster. Group hearing reported lot difficulty. wgq_mobility_3 Dummy roster. Group mobility reported lot difficulty. wgq_cognition_3 Dummy roster. Group cognition reported lot difficulty. wgq_self_care_3 Dummy roster. Group self care reported lot difficulty. wgq_communication_3 Dummy roster. Group communication reported lot difficulty. wgq_vision_4 Dummy roster. Group vision reported . wgq_hearing_4 Dummy roster. Group hearing reported . wgq_mobility_4 Dummy roster. Group mobility reported . wgq_cognition_4 Dummy roster. Group cognition reported . wgq_self_care_4 Dummy roster. Group self care reported . wgq_communication_4 Dummy roster. Group communication reported .

title: Add summarized individual WG-SS data to the household data — add_roster_wgq_ss
text: hh fifteen new columns: component dummy levels 3 4, disability level 3, level 4, level 3 4 together (summarized household).

what: Drinking water quantity classification - 5-point scale — drinking_water_quantity
title: Drinking water quantity classification - 5-point scale — drinking_water_quantity
text: drinking_water_quantity() recodes quantity drinking availability, drinking_water_quantity_score() classifies household 5-point scale.

title: Drinking water quantity classification - 5-point scale — drinking_water_quantity
code: drinking_water_quantity(   df,   drinking_water_quantity = "drinking_water_quantity",   level_codes = c("always", "often", "sometimes", "rarely", "never", "dont_know") )  drinking_water_quantity_score(   df,   drinking_water_quantity_cat = "drinking_water_quantity_cat",   level_codes = c("always", "often", "sometimes", "rarely", "never") )

title: Drinking water quantity classification - 5-point scale — drinking_water_quantity
text: df data frame. drinking_water_quantity Component column: Drinking water quantity. level_codes Character vector responses codes, including first following order: "Always (20 times)", "Often (11-20 times)", "Sometimes (3–10 times)", "Rarely (1–2 times)", "Never (0 times)", e.g. c("always", "often", "sometimes", "rarely", "never"). drinking_water_quantity_cat Component column: drinking water quantity categories.

title: Drinking water quantity classification - 5-point scale — drinking_water_quantity
text: One new column: 5-point scale 1 5 (drinking_water_quantity_class).

title: Drinking water source classification — drinking_water_source
text: drinking_water_source() recodes types water sources, time_to_fetch_water() categorical time fetch water according chosen threshold, drinking_water_source_score() classifies household/individual 5-point scale.

title: Drinking water source classification — drinking_water_source
code: drinking_water_source(   df,   drinking_water_source = "drinking_water_source",   improved,   unimproved,   surface_water,   na )  time_to_fetch_water(   df,   time_to_fetch_water,   above_threshold,   below_threshold,   premises,   na )  drinking_water_source_score(   df,   drinking_water_source_cat = "drinking_water_source_cat",   drinking_water_source_levels = c("improved", "unimproved", "surface_water"),   time_to_fetch_water_cat = "time_to_fetch_water_cat",   time_to_fetch_water_levels = c("premises", "below_threshold", "above_threshold") )

title: Drinking water source classification — drinking_water_source
text: df data frame. drinking_water_source Component column: Water source types. improved Character vector responses codes, "Protected well" "Public tap", e.g., c("protected_well", "public_tap"). unimproved Character vector responses codes, "Unprotected well" "Unprotected spring", e.g., c("unprotected_well", "unprotected_spring"). surface_water Character vector responses codes, "Lake" "River, e.g., c("lake", "river"). na Character vector responses codes, fit category, e.g., c(""). time_to_fetch_water Component column: Time fetch water. above_threshold Character vector responses codes, "30 minutes 59 minutes" "1 hour ", e.g., c("30mins_to_59mins", "1hour_above"). below_threshold Character vector responses codes, "5 14 minutes" "15 minutes 29 minutes", e.g., c("5mins_to_14mins", "15mins_to_29mins"). premises Character vector responses codes, "premises", e.g., c("premises"). drinking_water_source_cat Component column: categories drinking water sources. drinking_water_source_levels Drinking water sources levels - order: improved, unimproved, surface water. time_to_fetch_water_cat Component column: categories time fetch water. time_to_fetch_water_levels Time fetch water levels - order: premises, threshold, threshold.

title: Drinking water source classification — drinking_water_source
text: dataframe new column. drinking_water_source(), recoded column water sources improved, unimproved surface water (drinking_water_source_cat); time_to_fetch_water(), recoded column times fetch water according chosen thresholds (time_to_fetch_water_cat); drinking_water_source_score(), 5-point scale 1 5 (drinking_water_source_score).

title: Drinking water source classification — drinking_water_source
text: classification computed follows: Level 5: Surface water; Level 4: Unimproved water source; Level 3: Improved water source 30 minutes return time; Level 2: Improved water source within 30 minutes return time; Level 1: Improved water source premises.

what: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
title: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
text: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
code: fclcp(   df,   fcp = "fcp",   lcsi_cat_no_exhaustion = "lcsi_cat_no_exhaustion",   lcsi_levels = c("None", "Stress", "Crisis", "Emergency") )

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
text: df data frame. fcp food consumption phase column. lcsi_cat_no_exhaustion Livelihood Coping Strategies categories column without exhaustion strategies. lcsi_levels LCSI levels order: "None", "Stress", "Crisis", "Emergency.

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
text: Two new columns FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping matrix phases: numbers (fclp) categories (fclp_cat).

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption-Livelihood Coping Phase — fclcp
text: lcsi_cat_no_exhaustion must categories column calculated without using exhaustion strategies choices aggregating. See lcsi() argument with_exhaustion. calculation, see page 13 Fews Net matrix guidance available : https://fews.net/sites/default/files/documents/reports/fews-net-matrix-guidance-document.pdf.

what: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell — fcm_cell
title: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell — fcm_cell
text: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell — fcm_cell
code: fcm_cell(   df,   fcs_cat = "fcs_cat",   fcs_levels = c("Acceptable", "Borderline", "Poor"),   hhs_cat = "hhs_cat",   hhs_levels = c("None", "Little", "Moderate", "Severe", "Very severe"),   rcsi_cat = "rcsi_cat",   rcsi_levels = c("No to Low", "Medium", "Severe") )

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell — fcm_cell
text: df data frame. fcs_cat Food Consumption Score column. fcs_levels Food Consumption Score categories - order: "Poor", "Borderline", "Acceptable". hhs_cat Household Hunger Scale column. hhs_levels Household Hunger Scale categories - order: "None", "Little", "Moderate", "Severe", "severe". rcsi_cat reduced Coping Strategies Index column. rcsi_levels reduced Coping Strategies Index categories - order: "Low", "Medium", "Severe".

title: FEWS NET Food Consumption Matrix cell — fcm_cell
text: FEWS NET Food Consumption Cell number.

text: FC phase - Food Consumption phase according FCM

title: FC phase - Food Consumption phase according to the FCM — fcp
code: fcp(df, fcm_cell = "fcm_cell")

title: FC phase - Food Consumption phase according to the FCM — fcp
text: df data frame. fcm_cell Food consumption matrix cell - 1 45.

title: FC phase - Food Consumption phase according to the FCM — fcp

title: FCS - Food Consumption Score — fcs
text: FCS - Food Consumption Score

title: FCS - Food Consumption Score — fcs
code: fcs(   df,   fcs_cereal = "fcs_cereal",   fcs_legumes = "fcs_legumes",   fcs_dairy = "fcs_dairy",   fcs_meat = "fcs_meat",   fcs_veg = "fcs_veg",   fcs_fruit = "fcs_fruit",   fcs_oil = "fcs_oil",   fcs_sugar = "fcs_sugar",   cat = "normal" )

title: FCS - Food Consumption Score — fcs
text: df data frame fcs_cereal Cereals component column fcs_legumes Legumes component column fcs_dairy Dairy component column fcs_meat Meat component column fcs_veg Vegetables component column fcs_fruit Fruit component column fcs_oil Oil component column fcs_sugar Sugar component column cat Cut-offs categories, either "normal" (21.5/35) "alternate" (28/42)

title: FCS - Food Consumption Score — fcs
text: Ten new columns: component weight (fcs_w_), score (fcs_score) category (fcs_cat).

what: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
title: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
text: fies_raw_score() calculates raw score FIES. parameter estimates assessment statistics Rasch model thanks package RM.weights, see impactR.analysis::fies_estimates() (construction).

title: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
code: fies_raw_score(   df,   fies_worried = "fies_worried",   fies_healthy = "fies_healthy",   fies_fewfoods = "fies_fewfoods",   fies_skipped = "fies_skipped",   fies_ateless = "fies_ateless",   fies_ranout = "fies_ranout",   fies_hungry = "fies_hungry",   fies_wholeday = "fies_wholeday",   level_codes = c("yes", "no", "do_not_know", "prefer_not_to_answer") )

title: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
text: df data frame fies_worried Component column: Worried enough food eat. fies_healthy Component column: Unable eat healthy nutritious food. fies_fewfoods Component column: Ate kinds foods. fies_skipped Component column: Skip meal. fies_ateless Component column: Ate less thought . fies_ranout Component column: Ran food. fies_hungry Component column: Hungry without eating. fies_wholeday Component column: eating whole day. level_codes Character vector responses codes, including first following order: "Yes", "", "know", "Prefer answer", e.g., c("yes", "", "do_not_know", "prefer_not_to_answer")

title: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
text: Nine new columns: component dummy variable "Yes" (fies_*_d) FIES raw score (fiew_raw_score).

title: FIES - Food Insecurity Experience Scale analysis — fies_raw_score
text: recall period can different (30 days 12 months) depending research's objectives (food insecurity population monitoring instance).

what: Calculate main food security indicators — foodsec
title: Calculate main food security indicators — foodsec
text: Calculate main food security indicators

title: Calculate main food security indicators — foodsec
code: foodsec(   df,   fcs_cereal = "fcs_cereal",   fcs_legumes = "fcs_legumes",   fcs_dairy = "fcs_dairy",   fcs_meat = "fcs_meat",   fcs_veg = "fcs_veg",   fcs_fruit = "fcs_fruit",   fcs_oil = "fcs_oil",   fcs_sugar = "fcs_sugar",   fcs_cat = "normal",   hhs_lev1_nofoodhh = "hhs_lev1_nofoodhh",   hhs_lev2_nofoodhh = "hhs_lev2_nofoodhh",   hhs_lev1_sleephungry = "hhs_lev1_sleephungry",   hhs_lev2_sleephungry = "hhs_lev2_sleephungry",   hhs_lev1_alldaynight = "hhs_lev1_alldaynight",   hhs_lev2_alldaynight = "hhs_lev2_alldaynight",   hhs_level1_codes = c("yes", "no"),   hhs_level2_codes = c("rarely", "sometimes", "often"),   rcsi_lesspreferred = "rcsi_lesspreferred",   rcsi_borrowfood = "rcsi_borrowfood",   rcsi_limitportion = "rcsi_limitportion",   rcsi_restrict = "rcsi_restrict",   rcsi_reducemeals = "rcsi_reducemeals",   lcsi_stress_1 = "lcsi_stress_1",   lcsi_stress_2 = "lcsi_stress_2",   lcsi_stress_3 = "lcsi_stress_3",   lcsi_stress_4 = "lcsi_stress_4",   lcsi_crisis_1 = "lcsi_crisis_1",   lcsi_crisis_2 = "lcsi_crisis_2",   lcsi_crisis_3 = "lcsi_crisis_3",   lcsi_emergency_1 = "lcsi_emergency_1",   lcsi_emergency_2 = "lcsi_emergency_2",   lcsi_emergency_3 = "lcsi_emergency_3",   lcsi_level_codes = c("yes", "exhausted", "no_need", "not_applicable") )

title: Calculate main food security indicators — foodsec
text: df Data fcs_cereal Cereals component column fcs_legumes Legumes component column fcs_dairy Dairy component column fcs_meat Meat component column fcs_veg Vegetables component column fcs_fruit Fruit component column fcs_oil Oil component column fcs_sugar Sugar component column fcs_cat Cut-offs categories, either "normal" (21.5/35) "alternate" (28/42) hhs_lev1_nofoodhh Component column: food kind house hhs_lev2_nofoodhh Follow-frequency column hhs_lev1_sleephungry Component column: Go sleep hungry enough food hhs_lev2_sleephungry Follow-frequency column hhs_lev1_alldaynight Component column: Go whole day night without eating hhs_lev2_alldaynight Follow-frequency column hhs_level1_codes Character vector least "Yes" "" codes (order), e.g. c("yes", "") hhs_level2_codes Character vector least frequencies codes, following order: "Rarely", "Sometimes", "Often", e.g. c("rarely", "sometimes", "often") rcsi_lesspreferred Component column: Rely less preferred less expensive food rcsi_borrowfood Component column: Borrow food rely help friends relatives rcsi_limitportion Component column: Limit portion size mealtime rcsi_restrict Component column: Restrict consumption adults order small children eat rcsi_reducemeals Component column: Reduce number meals eaten day lcsi_stress_1 Component column: Stress strategy 1 lcsi_stress_2 Component column: Stress strategy 2 lcsi_stress_3 Component column: Stress strategy 3 lcsi_stress_4 Component column: Stress strategy 4 lcsi_crisis_1 Component column: Crisis strategy 1 lcsi_crisis_2 Component column: Crisis strategy 2 lcsi_crisis_3 Component column: Crisis strategy 3 lcsi_emergency_1 Component column: Emergency strategy 1 lcsi_emergency_2 Component column: Emergency strategy 2 lcsi_emergency_3 Component column: Emergency strategy 3 lcsi_level_codes Character vector responses codes, following order: ""Yes", ", exhausted", ", need", ", applicable", e.g. c("yes", "exhausted", "no_need", "not_applicable")

title: Calculate main food security indicators — foodsec
text: columns produced following functions: fcs(), hhs(), rcsi(), lcs(), fcm(), fcp() fclp().

title: Handwashing facility classification — handwashing_facility
text: handwashing_facility() recodes types handwasing facility, handwashing_facility_score() classifies household/individual 2-point scale.

title: Handwashing facility classification — handwashing_facility
code: handwashing_facility(   df,   handwashing_facility = "handwashing_facility",   soap_and_water = c("yes_soap_water"),   none = c("no", "yes_only_soap", "yes_only_water"),   na = c("dnk", "no_access") )  handwashing_facility_score(   df,   handwashing_facility_cat = "handwashing_facility_cat",   handwashing_facility_levels = c("none", "soap_and_water") )

title: Handwashing facility classification — handwashing_facility
text: df data frame. handwashing_facility Component column: Handwashing facility types. soap_and_water Character vector responses codes, "Yes, available soap water (seen)" , e.g., c("yes_soap_water"). none Character vector responses codes, "Yes, soap", "Yes, water" "", e.g., c("", "yes_only_soap", "yes_only_water"). na Character vector responses codes, "know" "access", e.g., c("dnk","no_access"). handwashing_facility_cat Component column: Categories handwashing facility. handwashing_facility_levels Handwashing facility levels - order: none, soap water.

title: Handwashing facility classification — handwashing_facility
text: data frame new column named handwashing_facility_cat (handwashing_facility()) handwashing_facility_score (handwashing_facility_score()) appended.

title: Handwashing facility classification — handwashing_facility
text: classification computed follows: Level 2: handwashing facility available, water soap available handwashing facility; Level 1: Handwashing facility available soap water;

what: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version) — hdds
title: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version) — hdds
text: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version)

title: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version) — hdds
code: hdds(   df,   hdds_cereal = "hdds_ceral",   hdds_roots = "hdds_roots",   hdds_legumes = "hdds_legumes",   hdds_dairy = "hdds_dairy",   hdds_meat = "hdds_meat",   hdds_fish = "hdds_fish",   hdds_egg = "hdds_egg",   hdds_veg = "hdds_veg",   hdds_fruits = "hdds_fruits",   hdds_oil = "hdds_oil",   hdds_sugar = "hdds_sugar",   hdds_spices = "hdds_spices",   level_codes = c("yes", "no", "do_not_know", "prefer_not_to_answer") )

title: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version) — hdds
text: df data frame hdds_cereal Cereals grain component column hdds_roots Roots tubers component column hdds_legumes Legumes, pulses, nuts component column hdds_dairy Dairy, milk, others component column hdds_meat Meat component column hdds_fish Fish shellfish component column hdds_egg Eggs component column hdds_veg Vegetables component column hdds_fruits Fruits component column hdds_oil Oil component column hdds_sugar Sugar component column hdds_spices Spices component column level_codes Character vector responses codes, including first following order: "Yes", "", "know", "Prefer answer", e.g., c("yes", "", "do_not_know", "prefer_not_to_answer").

title: HHDS - Household Dietary Diversity Score (standalone version) — hdds
text: Thirteen new columns: component dummy variable "Yes" (hdds_*_d) HDDS score (hdds_score).

title: HHS - Household Hunger Scale — hhs
text: HHS - Household Hunger Scale

title: HHS - Household Hunger Scale — hhs
code: hhs(   df,   hhs_lev1_nofoodhh = "hhs_lev1_nofoodhh",   hhs_lev2_nofoodhh = "hhs_lev2_nofoodhh",   hhs_lev1_sleephungry = "hhs_lev1_sleephungry",   hhs_lev2_sleephungry = "hhs_lev2_sleephungry",   hhs_lev1_alldaynight = "hhs_lev1_alldaynight",   hhs_lev2_alldaynight = "hhs_lev2_alldaynight",   level1_codes = c("yes", "no"),   level2_codes = c("rarely", "sometimes", "often") )

title: HHS - Household Hunger Scale — hhs
text: df data frame hhs_lev1_nofoodhh Component column: food kind house hhs_lev2_nofoodhh Follow-frequency column hhs_lev1_sleephungry Component column: Go sleep hungry enough food hhs_lev2_sleephungry Follow-frequency column hhs_lev1_alldaynight Component column: Go whole day night without eating hhs_lev2_alldaynight Follow-frequency column level1_codes Character vector full set values, particular "Yes" "" codes first (order), e.g. c("yes", "") level2_codes Character vector full set values, particular, frequencies first, following order: "Rarely", "Sometimes", "Often", e.g. c("rarely", "sometimes", "often")

title: HHS - Household Hunger Scale — hhs
text: Five new columns: component recoded hhs_comp1, hhs_comp2, hhs_comp3, overall score (hhs_score) categories (hhs_cat).

what: HWISE scores - Household Water Insecurity Experiences (HWISE) Scale — hwise
title: HWISE scores - Household Water Insecurity Experiences (HWISE) Scale — hwise
text: HWISE scores - Household Water Insecurity Experiences (HWISE) Scale

title: HWISE scores - Household Water Insecurity Experiences (HWISE) Scale — hwise

title: HWISE scores - Household Water Insecurity Experiences (HWISE) Scale — hwise

title: Sanitation facility classification — sanitation_facility
code: sanitation_facility(   df,   sanitation_facility = "sanitation_facility",   improved,   unimproved,   open_defecation,   na )  sharing_sanitation_facility(   df,   sharing_sanitation_facility = "sharing_sanitation_facility" )  sanitation_facility_score(   df,   sanitation_facility_cat = "sanitation_facility_cat",   sanitation_facility_levels = c("improved", "unimproved", "open_defecation"),   sharing_sanitation_facility_cat = "sharing_sanitation_facility_cat",   sharing_sanitation_facility_levels = c("19_and_below", "20_to_49", "50_and_above") )

title: Sanitation facility classification — sanitation_facility
text: df data frame. sanitation_facility Component column: Sanitation facility types. improved Character vector responses codes, "Composting toilet" "Pour flush toilet", e.g., c("composting toilet", "pour_flush_toilet"). unimproved Character vector responses codes, "Bucket" "Hanging latrine", e.g., c("bucket", "hanging_latrine"). open_defecation Character vector responses codes, "Open defecation", e.g., c("open_defecation"). na Character vector responses codes, fit category, e.g., c(""). sharing_sanitation_facility Component column: Number people facility shared. sanitation_facility_cat Component column: categories sanitation facilities. sanitation_facility_levels Sanitation facilities levels - order: improved, unimproved, open defecation. sharing_sanitation_facility_cat Component column: categories number people sharing sanitation facilities. sharing_sanitation_facility_levels Sharing sanitation facilities levels - order: 19 , 20 49, 50 .

title: Sanitation facility classification — sanitation_facility
text: Three new columns: recoded column sanitation facilities improved, unimproved open defecation  (sanitation_facility_recoded), null recoded column number persons sharing facility (sharing_sanitation_facility_recoded), 5-point scale 1 5 (sanitation_facility_class).

title: Sanitation facility classification — sanitation_facility
text: classification computed follows: Level 5: Open defecation; Level 4: Unimproved sanitation facility; Level 3: Improved sanitation facility 50 people; Level 2: Improved sanitation facility 20 49 people; Level 1: Improved sanitation facility less 19 people. sharing_sanitation_facility null, levels 4 5 change, improved sanitation facilities assign 1.

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: page lists tidy eval tools reexported package rlang. learn using tidy eval scripts packages high level, see dplyr programming vignette ggplot2 packages vignette. Metaprogramming section Advanced R may also useful deeper dive. tidy eval operators {{, !!, !!! syntactic constructs specially interpreted tidy eval functions. mostly need {{, !! !!! advanced operators use simple cases. curly-curly operator {{ allows tunnel data-variables passed function arguments inside tidy eval functions. {{ designed individual arguments. pass multiple arguments contained dots, use ... normal way.   enquo() enquos() delay execution one several function arguments. former returns single expression, latter returns list expressions. defused, expressions longer evaluate . must injected back evaluation context !! (single expression) !!! (list expressions).   simple case, code equivalent usage {{ ... . Defusing enquo() enquos() needed complex cases, instance need inspect modify expressions way. .data pronoun object represents current slice data. variable name string, use .data pronoun subset variable [[.   Another tidy eval operator :=. makes possible use glue curly-curly syntax LHS =. technical reasons, R language support complex expressions left =, use := workaround.   Many tidy eval functions like dplyr::mutate() dplyr::summarise() give automatic name unnamed inputs. need create sort automatic names , use as_label(). instance, glue-tunnelling syntax can reproduced manually :   Expressions defused enquo() (tunnelled {{) need simple column names, can arbitrarily complex. as_label() handles cases gracefully. code assumes simple column name, use as_name() instead. safer throws error input name expected.
code: my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   data %>%     group_by(...) %>%     summarise(mean = mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   # Defuse   var <- enquo(var)   dots <- enquos(...)    # Inject   data %>%     group_by(!!!dots) %>%     summarise(mean = mean(!!var)) } my_var <- "disp" mtcars %>% summarise(mean = mean(.data[[my_var]])) my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   # Use `{{` to tunnel function arguments and the usual glue   # operator `{` to interpolate plain strings.   data %>%     summarise("{{ var }}_mean_{suffix}" := mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   var <- enquo(var)   prefix <- as_label(var)   data %>%     summarise("{prefix}_mean_{suffix}" := mean(!!var)) }

what: Shape the time to fetch water to recoding state — time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char
title: Shape the time to fetch water to recoding state — time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char
text: time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char() recodes time fetch water categorical thresholds (incl. ) time_to_fetch_water_combine() combines recoded integer variable character variable one final character time fetch water. See 2023 MSNA indicator bank information.

title: Shape the time to fetch water to recoding state — time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char
code: time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char(   df,   var,   int = c(0, 30, 60, 600),   char = c("premises", "30_min_or_less", "more_than_30_to_1hr", "more_than_1hr"),   int_dontknow = c(-999, 999),   char_dontknow = "dnk",   sl_piped_into_dwelling = TRUE,   var_piped_into_dwelling = "drinking_water_source",   codes_piped_into_dwelling = c("piped_into_dwelling") )  time_to_fetch_water_combine(   df,   var_int_to_char = "time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char",   var_dontknow = "time_to_fetch_water_dontknow",   level_codes = c("premises, 30_min_or_less, more_than_30_to_1hr, more_than_1hr, dnk") )

title: Shape the time to fetch water to recoding state — time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char
text: df data frame. var name integer variable recoded. int vector integer thresholds define thresholds. char vector labels category. labels correspond categories defined thresholds. first label corresponds values less equal first threshold, second label corresponds values greater first threshold less equal second threshold, . int_dontknow vector integer values treated "know" replaced char_dontknow. char_dontknow character value used label "know" values. sl_piped_into_dwelling logical value indicating whether skip logic implemented using variable var_piped_into_dwelling. TRUE, function recode variable var_piped_into_dwelling premises whenever codes_piped_into_dwelling recoding var. var_piped_into_dwelling name variable recoded premises. codes_piped_into_dwelling vector codes recoded premises. var_int_to_char recoded integer variable. var_dontknow character variable know. level_codes character level codes.

title: Shape the time to fetch water to recoding state — time_to_fetch_water_int_to_char
text: input data frame recoded variable added new column.

title: humind 0.0.5.2
text: Breaking change: drinking_water_quantity() now recodes frequencies days without drinking water, drinking_water_quantity_score() assigns score 5-point scale. Added: time_to_fetch_water_int_char() time_to_fetch_water_combine() recode combine variables time fetch water.

title: humind 0.0.5.1
text: Bug fix breaking change: handwashing_facility() now recodes types handwashing facility. Added: handwashing_facility_score() calculates score 2-point scale based handwashing_facility()

title: humind 0.0.5
text: Breaking changes: revamp water sources sanitation facilities fonctions approach food security functions. Added: drinking_water_source() recodes types water sources, time_to_fetch_water() time fetch water according chosen threshold, drinking_water_source_score() classify household/individual 5-point scale. Added: sanitation_facility() recodes types sanitation facilities, sharing_sanitation_facility() recodes number people sharing sanitation facility, sanitation_facility_score() classify household 5-point scale.

title: humind 0.0.4
text: Added water_source(): Water source 5-point-scale. Added sanitation_facility(): Sanitation facility 5-point scale. Added handwashing_facility(): Handwashing facility 2-point scale. Added drinking_water_quantity(): Drinking water quantity 5-point scale.

title: humind 0.0.3
text: Added hdds(): Household Dietary Diversity Scores (HDDS) (#5) Added fies(): Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES) #6 Bug fix: error lcsi() aggregated categories’ names corrected (#20)

title: humind 0.0.2
text: Added: HWISE functions. (#16) Updated: dplyr v1.1.0 dplyr::case_when() revamp. (#) Modified: dependency know goes impactR.utils impactR. (#)
